Message.Title: it is up, this week, 16 dec
Message.Msg: It was a different This week, 16th of December, 2012. Fewer sponsors, though the natural gas and life insurance pressure groups were present, also the BP spot lauding Gulf sites and “rent a car your way”… And yes, “In memoriam” mentioned five in US military who made the ultimate sacrifice in Afghanistan, mostly in their 20s, one from upstate New York, the others nearby Penna, somewhat less nearby Ohio, also texas and its nearby LA. This week was held in the Sandy Hook elementary library, two days after a library clerk guarded young children from danger. Program theme, of course, “Tragedy at the elementary school”, and parent Robbie Parker’s words were prominently mentioned as he remembered and eulogized his six year old Emilie. His words merit being included in Vital speeches, if that magazine still exists. Emilie, Robbie said, was the kind of oldest sister to whom her young sisters, ages about 4 and 3, would turn to for love and sympathy after a minor hurt. Mr Parker’s story was but one, and we realize that. We ask, Geo Stephanopoulos, says, “Why?” And yes 20,000-plus Newtown, a close knit,yes prosperous community, will find ways to heal. An ABC reporter, at Sunday Catholic church services, said all are coming together. But of course always, all will remember. Gov Mulloy, on This week, spoke of “an extraordinary set of heroic stories”—victim teacher Miss Soto, who survived, Miss Koig, who shepherded her kids to a tiny rest room, and made sure, if gunfire hit them, their final memories would be of a caring, concerned teacher reminding them ‘I love you:.” Sen Richard Blumenthal also noted Newtown is a “community coming together”, but that “we need to do something’. Donna Brazile spoke of her southern heritage, her knowledge of guns, and neighbors making sporting use of them—“but not assault rifles”. G F Will spoke of the interest in “doing something, legally”, yet there are still psychotic persons out there. Assault rifle ban, briefly in effect, did not lower gun violence during its existence, nor did such violence increase after its legal demise. Moderate mention of the need for added mental health services, with mention of parents fearing their children past age 18, and yes often the absence of insurance coverage for mental health services. Joe Klein, of time magazine, spoke of a culture of violence, the power of course of the first amendment, but the harm that culture is causing. Yes names of the victims, alphabetical, were provided—students, aged six or seven, and the six adults slain in the school. Columbine had its heroines, clearly Newtown does in Miss Soto and the principal who went into the hall to investigate the gun threat, to die trying to stop him, and also the incredible Emilie Parker…let her stand for her 19 fellow victims, with names evoking our country’s present and past heritage. This week did not mention the Newtown Memorial Fund. No matter, a check was sent yesterday afternoon.

Message.Title: Gun Owner Confronted Oregon Mall Shooter
Message.Msg: Something you won't hear in the #$%$ mainstream media!! "A gun-toting civilian saved lives by confronting a deranged man on a shooting spree at a Portland, Oregon shopping mall last week, confounding a progressive narrative calling for the banning of firearms. Nick Meli, 22, was at the Clackamas Town Center last Wednesday with a friend and her baby when a masked man opened fire. “I heard three shots and turned and looked at Casey and said, ‘are you serious?,’” Meli told local television news station KGW. After securing his friend and her baby, Meli, a former security guard at the mall, drew his gun and went to confront the man. When shooter Jacob Roberts stopped his assault to deal with a jammed gun, Meli came out and drew down on him. The two made eye contact. Meli, who has a Concealed Carry permit for his weapon, did not fire on Roberts after seeing someone behind the target. If he missed hitting Roberts, he could have hit the civilian in the background. Meli stands by that decision. “I’m not beating myself up cause I didn’t shoot him,” he explained. “I know after he saw me, I think the last shot he fired was the one he used on himself.” Roberts turned the gun on himself after seeing Meli, the only shot fired after being confronted. While two people were killed in the rampage, it could have been more had Meli not been there with his own weapon. The incident, although reported by local Oregon media, was not included in the narrative reported by national media outlets that covered the tragic incident." CONCEAL CARRY IN ALL STATES! SCREW OBAMA FEINSTEIN AND BLOOMBERG THE NAZI'S!
